root.name: set()

example.code: size(100, 100) v = PVector(0.0, 0.0, 0.0) v.set(20.0, 30.0, 40.0) print(v.x) # Prints "20.0" print(v.y) # Prints "30.0" print(v.z) # Prints "40.0"
size(100, 100) v1 = PVector(20.0, 30.0, 40.0) v2 = PVector(0.0, 0.0, 0.0) v2.set(v1) print(v2.x) # Prints "20.0" print(v2.y) # Prints "30.0" print(v2.z) # Prints "40.0"
vvv = [20.0, 30.0, 40.0] size(100, 100) v = PVector(0.0, 0.0, 0.0) v.set(vvv) print(v.x) # Prints "20.0" print(v.y) # Prints "30.0" print(v.z) # Prints "40.0"

root.description: Sets the x, y, and z component of the vector using three separate variables, the data from a PVector, or the values from a float array.

parameter.label: x
parameter.description: float: the x component of the vector

parameter.label: y
parameter.description: float: the y component of the vector

parameter.label: z
parameter.description: float: the z component of the vector

parameter.label: x
parameter.description: float: the x component of the vector

parameter.label: y
parameter.description: float: the y component of the vector

parameter.label: v
parameter.description: float: the y component of the vector
